title: 'Inactive COVID-19 jabs show lower side effects risk'
description: Turkish health minister says inactive vaccines to be less affected by mutations - Anadolu Ajans
cleaned_text: lower side effects risk' Turkish health minister says inactive vaccines to be less affected by mutations ANKARA Inactive novel coronavirus vaccines are less likely to cause unwanted side effects, Turkey's health minister said on Friday. Underlining that this kind of vaccine was also less susceptible to becoming ineffective against new mutations of the virus, Fahrettin Koca said on Twitter that Turkey continued working to procure the best possible jabs for the country's people. On Jan. 14, Turkey began a mass COVID-vaccination campaign starting with healthcare workers, along with top officials to encourage public confidence in the vaccines. The country has received multiple shipments of inactive CoronaVac vaccines developed by the Chinese Sinovac firm.
